aspect: 1. Jordan Henderson is set to sign a new long-term contract at Anfield.
2. The new deal will run to 2020 and is worth around £100,000-a-week.
3. Henderson is one of the most improved players under Brendan Rodgers.
4. He has contributed 13 assists and 7 goals from midfield.
5. Talks with Raheem Sterling are not expected to resume until the end of the season.
explain: One of the most significant developments in Liverpool's recent history is that star midfielder, Jordan Henderson, is considering putting pen to paper on a new long-term contract that would keep him at Anfield for five more years.

The aspect states that Henderson has signed a new contract with Liverpool that will keep him at the club until 2020, and the deal is reportedly worth around £100,000-a-week. This shows the club's commitment to keeping their key players and their value of Henderson's contributions to the team.

One of the core ideas of the aspect is that Henderson is considered as one of the most improved player under the guidance and management of Brendan Rodgers. Rodgers has been able to bring out the best in Henderson and has helped him grow and develop as a player. Henderson has shown significant progression in his skills, performance, and overall contribution to the team. His recent assists showcase his improved playmaking abilities and his willingness to contribute to the team's success.
One core idea of the given aspect is that Henderson has been very productive in terms of assists this season, contributing 13 of them from his midfield position.
One core idea of the aspect is that discussions with Raheem Sterling, another Liverpool player, are not scheduled to resume until the season's conclusion.
